intro: Bellermannia spicata, commonly known as the spike bellermannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers in late spring. The plant is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia, where it thrives in moist, acidic soils. It is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
